subject: Is it possible to mix junit4 tests with legacy junit3 tests
msgSnippet: Hi All - I am finally moving to junit4 and would like to keep my old tests (in junit3) while adding new tests using junit4 annotations. Here is an example of
messageBody:
Hi All -

I am finally moving to junit4 and would like to keep my old tests (in junit3) while adding new tests using junit4 annotations. Here is an example of my old tests:

package com.test.libraries;

import junit.framework.*;
import org.apache.log4j.*;


public class AllTests {

public static final Logger _logger = Logger.getLogger(AllTests.class);

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Test for com.clinworx.libraries");
_logger.debug("Beginning unit testing for com.clinworx.libraries");
//add JUnit Tests below suite.addTestSuite(Class.class);
suite.addTestSuite(StandardLibrariesTest.class);
_logger.debug("Ending unit testing for com.clinworx.libraries");
return suite;
}
}



package com.test.libraries;

import junit.framework.*;
import org.apache.log4j.*;


public class StandardLibrariesTest extends TestCase {

public static final Logger _logger = Logger.getLogger(StandardLibrariesTest.class);

public StandardLibrariesTest (String name) {
super(name);
}

public void testNumberOne() {
assertTrue(true);
}
}

Is it possible to add the following to StandardLibrariesTest.java and have it run?

@Test
public void numberTwo() {
assertTrue(true);
}

Thanks for the help.

Carter
